system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice adverbs and adverb phrases: types and meanings by Describing countries with adverbs and adjectives. I want to ensure that I Can use a range of degree adverbs to modify common gradable adjectives. For example, 'really nice, very good, so bad, too hot, quite interesting'. Let's do a Q&A exercise. Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. User: Hello!; System:

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a Q&A exercise, by Describing countries with adverbs and adjectives, using, for example, 'really nice, very good, so bad, too hot, quite interesting'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello! My country is quite large and very diverse. Is your country very big too?
No, my country is quite small but really beautiful.
That sounds lovely! My country is also really beautiful, with many stunning landscapes. Is your hometown very peaceful or quite busy?
"Peaceful" means really calm and quite quiet, while "busy" means very full of activity and very noisy. So, is your hometown very calm and very quiet, or is it very full of activity and very noisy?
conversation.advanced_content: "Peaceful" means really calm and quite quiet, while "busy" means extremely full of activity and very noisy. So, is your hometown very calm and completely quiet, or is it overly full of activity and too noisy?

conversation.content: My hometown is really peaceful and quite calm. How about your city? Is it very busy or quite relaxed?

My city is quite busy and very lively, but it also has some really peaceful areas. It’s nice to have both! I’m glad your hometown is so calm—it sounds like a really nice place to live. Thanks for practicing adverbs with me today! Continue doing well! 😊
